title: Creating a Graphic Fashion Image with the Westcott Optical Spot
summary: Fashion photographer Lindsay Adler demonstrates how to create a bold, graphic fashion image by combining precise light shaping using the Westcott Optical Spot, vibrant color gels, and creative DIY styling props.

steps.action: Introduce the main light modifier, the Westcott Optical Spot, explaining its ability to create slices of light using built-in shutters.
Position the main light (Profoto D2 with Optical Spot) to the left and adjust shutters to light only a slice of the subject's profile.
Set up a second strobe (Profoto D2) on the background with no modifier.
Add a red gel to the background strobe to transform the gray background into a vibrant red hue.
Introduce a DIY graphic headpiece made of cardboard and velvet, attached to a C-stand arm for flexibility.
Select camera gear: Canon EOS R5 with RF 24-105mm lens for focal length flexibility.
Turn on the main light and adjust the lens focus on the Optical Spot to sharpen the edges of the light slice.
Turn on the background light to create a red backdrop with a natural gradient towards the top.
Position the DIY headpiece behind the subject to create a graphic silhouette effect.
Direct the model's pose and capture the final image combining all elements.

key_takeaways: The Optical Spot allows for precise control over light and shadow shapes on a subject.
Using colored gels on a neutral gray background can create vibrant, saturated colors.
DIY props can be used to create high-impact, graphic shapes in fashion photography.
Mounting props on C-stands offers more flexibility than attaching them directly to the model.
